def.dt: :to believe that something or someone is good or acceptable I don't care if all the other parents are letting their kids do it; I still don't approve. often + of I still don't approve of it. I don't approve of the way he treats his wife. = I don't approve of him treating his wife the way he does. opposite disapprove

:to officially accept (an idea, action, plan, etc.) The state has approved the building plans, so work on the new school can begin immediately. Your supervisor must approve the report before it can be sent. often used as (be) approved The drug is expected to be approved as a treatment for cancer by the end of the year. Your application has been approved.
